attributes.action: Do not accept the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill 2021
attributes.additional_details: In light of the events of Clapham Common on 13th March, it would be insensitive to give police greater authority when we have seen it first hand that many officers can't be trusted to enforce the law in a professional sense.
attributes.background:
We demand this bill to be rejected.
The Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill 2021 seeks to give police greater authority during protests, which given the events of the past 12 months inspires zero confidence that this will benefit the safety of protestors.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not pass the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579242

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875
